fields.descriptive_line:
[Leather panel] Part of a gilt leather hanging consisting of two panels, a side-border and bottom-border. Gilded and silvered, and painted in red and green on a gilt ground, Italy, ca. 1600-1650.

[Leather panel] Part of a gilt leather hanging consisting of two panels, two top-boders and 1.5 side-border. Executed in gold, silver, red and green on a gilt ground, Italy, ca. 1600-1650.

[Leather panel] Gilt leather border ornamented with S-shaped gilded curves united by shaped silver panels, each enclosing a green and gilded rosette on a red ground. The gilded parts are punched with small stamps, Italy, ca. 1600-1650.

[Leather panel] Gilt leather border ornamented with S-shaped gilded curves united by shaped silver panels, each enclosing a green and gilded rosette on a red ground. The gilded parts are punched with small stamps, Italy, ca. 1600-1650.
fields.physical_description:
[Leather panel] Part of a gilt leather hanging consisting of two panels, a side-border and bottom-border. Executed in gold, silver, red and green on a gilt ground. This panel was part of a large hanging, described originally as: Gilt leather hanging consisting of four panels, with fourteen borders. Each piece forming the large pattern is divided by red curves, forming a kind of diagonal, and enclosing a shaped ornament in gold. These diagonals form spaces of geometrical form filled in with symmetrically arranged bunches of flowers in gold, silver, red, and green, on a silver ground. The borders are ornamented with S-shaped curves in gold united by curiously shaped silver panels, each enclosing a rosette in green and gold on a red ground. The panel is further decorated with small stamped diapers.

[Leather panel] Part of a gilt leather hanging consisting of two panels, two top-boders and 1.5 side-border. Executed in gold, silver, red and green on a gilt ground. Executed in gold, silver, red and green on a gilt ground. This panel was part of a large hanging, described originally as: Gilt leather hanging consisting of four panels, with fourteen borders. Each piece forming the large pattern is divided by red curves, forming a kind of diagonal, and enclosing a shaped ornament in gold. These diagonals form spaces of geometrical form filled in with symmetrically arranged bunches of flowers in gold, silver, red, and green, on a silver ground. The borders are ornamented with S-shaped curves in gold united by curiously shaped silver panels, each enclosing a rosette in green and gold on a red ground. The panel is further decorated with small stamped diapers.

[Leather panel] Gilt leather border ornamented with S-shaped gilded curves united by curiously shaped silver panels, each enclosing a green and gilded rosette on a red ground. The gilded parts are punched with small stamps. This border was part of a large hanging, described originally as: Gilt leather hanging consisting of four panels, with fourteen borders. Each piece forming the large pattern is divided by red curves, forming a kind of diagonal, and enclosing a shaped ornament in gold. These diagonals form spaces of geometrical form filled in with symmetrically arranged bunches of flowers in gold, silver, red, and green, on a silver ground. The borders are ornamented with S-shaped curves in gold united by curiously shaped silver panels, each enclosing a rosette in green and gold on a red ground. The panel is further decorated with small stamped diapers.
[Leather panel] Gilt leather border ornamented with S-shaped gilded curves united by curiously shaped silver panels, each enclosing a green and gilded rosette on a red ground. The gilded parts are punched with small stamps. This border was part of a large hanging, described originally as: Gilt leather hanging consisting of four panels, with fourteen borders. Each piece forming the large pattern is divided by red curves, forming a kind of diagonal, and enclosing a shaped ornament in gold. These diagonals form spaces of geometrical form filled in with symmetrically arranged bunches of flowers in gold, silver, red, and green, on a silver ground. The borders are ornamented with S-shaped curves in gold united by curiously shaped silver panels, each enclosing a rosette in green and gold on a red ground. The panel is further decorated with small stamped diapers.

fields.history_note:
The gilt leather wall hanging V&A, museum numbers 141-1882 and 694-1890. The gilt leather wall hanging in the pawnshop in Treviso, dated in the first half of the 17th century, has a very similar pattern as the panels, but not identical. 

Formerly described as 'Florentine, 16th century'. There is, however, no exact information available (not in Italy or elsewhere) to keep this attribution any longer standing. The whole group of  panels and hangings that were acquired from Bardini were, without any exception, being described in this way, although for instance inventory number 732-1890 has proven to be of a Dutch origin. Information supplied by Eloy Koldeweij, October 1996.

Purchase price of £1000 for a group of leather objects (museum numbers: 682-1890 to 732-1890).
